guest.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: someone who is invited to an event or special occasion
guest.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Among the invited guests were Jerry Brown and Elihu Harris.
The actress was guest of honour (=the most important guest) at the launch.
I’ve nearly finished the guest list for the wedding.
Most of the wedding guests had left.
You are here as my guests.
guest.translation[0].definitions[0].note: In everyday English, people usually talk about having friends/people over (for a meal, short visit etc) or having friends/people to stay rather than saying that they have guests:
We’re having some people over for dinner this evening.
guest.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: someone you have invited to stay in your home for a short time
guest.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: We have guests staying right now.
guest.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: someone who is paying to stay in a hotel
guest.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Use of the sauna is free to guests.
guest.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: someone famous who is invited to take part in a show, concert etc, in addition to those who usually take part
guest.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: We have some great guests for you tonight.
Fontaine appeared as a guest on the show.
guest.translation[0].note_box[0].section: The prime minister was one of the main guests at the event.
They were the honoured guests of the Queen at the Royal Garden Party.
Many distinguished guests were invited to the opening ceremony.
How much meat do I need to buy for 15 dinner guests?
We need to send out invitations to all the wedding guests.
There was a constant stream of house guests at their country estate.
Celebrations continued with a dinner for 100 invited guests.
Security guards were employed to keep out unwelcome guests.
She was surprised when an uninvited guest turned up at the door.
The Johnsons were regular guests at Eric’s house in Notting Hill.
The guest list included many friends from his university days.
The guest speaker at the conference was Dr. Kim.
The senator was guest of honour at a reception held at the American Embassy.
The guests were invited to a dinner at his country house.
Roger was busy greeting the guests as they arrived.
Their garden is a wonderful place to entertain guests.
guest.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: He was still asleep in the guest bedroom.
guest.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: a guest star, speaker etc is someone famous or important who is invited to take part in an event, in addition to the people who usually take part
guest.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: Camfield was lucky in getting Cage and Rampling as guest stars.
He will make a special guest appearance on next week’s show.
guest.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: to take part in a show, concert etc as a guest
guest.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: She guested on a comedy show last year.
guest.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: someone who is paying to stay in a hotel
guest.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: The hotel still prepares guests’ bills by hand.
